New Records: The Angels set a franchise record for losses with 96 losses in the season.
The White Sox tied the major-league record for most losses in a season with 120 losses.
Key Match Events: The White Sox won 7-0 against the Angels on September 26, 2024.
Miguel Vargas scored past Angels catcher Logan O’Hoppe off Andrew Vaughn’s two-run single during the fifth inning.
The White Sox scored seven runs in the fifth inning, their season high.
Post-Match Reflections: Angels catcher Logan O’Hoppe expressed frustration and disappointment over the season's outcome.
Shortstop Zach Neto mentioned the season as a learning step for the team.
Pitcher Tyler Anderson reflected on his mixed performance throughout the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shortstop Zach Neto left the game with right shoulder irritation but is expected to return soon.
The Angels' inability to turn a key double play in the fifth inning contributed to their loss.
